cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 141 (Wednesday, September 11, 2024)][House][Pages H5202-H5203]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SHERRILL:H.R. 9548.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 18 of Section 8 of Article 1 of the Constitution ofthe United States of AmericaThe single subject of this legislation is:Supporting military families by expanding access to high-impact tutoring programs at DoDEA schoolsADDITIONAL SPONSORSUnder clause 7 of rule XII, sponsors were added to public bills andresolutions, as follows:H.R. 53: Mr. Waltz, Mr. Strong, Mr. Armstrong, and Mr.D'Esposito.H.R. 87: Mrs. Luna.H.R. 92: Mrs. Luna.H.R. 333: Mr. Kelly of Mississippi.H.R. 1015: Mr. Brecheen.[[Page H5203]]H.R. 1139: Mrs. McClain, Mr. Armstrong, and Mrs. Kim ofCalifornia.H.R. 1239: Ms. Wilson of Florida.H.R. 1277: Mr. Keating.H.R. 1491: Mr. Schneider.H.R. 1507: Mrs. Dingell.H.R. 1572: Mr. Scott of Virginia.H.R. 1608: Mr. Grothman.H.R. 1666: Ms. Pingree.H.R. 1705: Mrs. Foushee.H.R. 1770: Mrs. Fischbach and Mr. Pence.H.R. 1822: Mr. Miller item.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: High-Impact Tutoring for Military Families Act

item.title: High-Impact Tutoring for Military Families Act
High-Impact Tutoring for Military Families Act
To direct the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study on high-impact tutoring in schools operated by the Department of Defense Education Activity, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
